H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1900.def: = action by which humans speaks softly for themselves as if thinking out load

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H2420.def: = action by which humans or deities utter words that are often compacted and well-formulated and that require wisdom to be understood

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6120.def: = the back part of the foot of humans and animals below the ankle

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3365.def: = state in which humans are valuable and worthy of respect in the eyes of others

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H1198.def: = state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3366.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H1820.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3689.def: = area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H8371.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H7287.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise authority over (other) humans, animals, and areas, often with focus on the manner in which this is done

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H6736.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing in the form of an image or a drawing; ► functioning in non-sanctioned rituals or as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H2073.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside; ≈ associated with high status

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3366.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H1820.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

16.gl: to see the light > to live
